notes: This map illustrates satellite-detected damage in a portion of the city of Deir Ez Zor, Syrian Arab Republic. Using satellite imagery acquired 9 November 2017, 25 May 2016, 10 May 2015, 13 May 2014, and 24 October 2013, UNITAR - UNOSAT identified a total of 6,348 affected structures within the city. Approximately 1,144 of these were destroyed, 2,348 severely damaged, and 2,856 moderately damaged. While much of the city was damaged by 25 May 2016, 1,859 structures were newly damaged and 386 structures experienced an increase in damage between that date and 9 November 2017. This analysis does not include pre-war military bases and facilities. This is a preliminary analysis and has not yet been validated in the field. Please send ground feedback to UNITAR - UNOSAT.
